title:
A candidate dark matter deficient dwarf galaxy in the Fornax cluster
  identified through overluminous star clusters
authors: Aaron J. Romanowsky, Enrique Cabrera, Steven R. Janssens
abstract:
Two low surface brightness (LSB) dwarf galaxies were identified recently as
having little or no dark matter (DM), provoking widespread interest in their
formation histories. These galaxies also host populous systems of star clusters
that are on average larger and more luminous than typical globular clusters
(GCs). We report an initial attempt to identify new candidate DM-deficient
dwarfs via their unusual GC systems. Using a large catalog of LSB galaxies from
the Dark Energy Survey, we inspect their Dark Energy Camera Legacy Survey
(DECaLS) imaging and identify FCC 224 as a candidate found on the outskirts of
the Fornax cluster. We analyze the GC system using DECaLS and archival Hubble
Space Telescope WFPC2 imaging, and find an apparent population of overluminous
GCs. More detailed follow-up of FCC 224 is in progress.
